meanings.definition: The right or condition of self-government.
meanings.sent1: In some countries, regions have autonomies to govern themselves.
meanings.sent2: The autonomies granted to the local councils allowed them to make decisions independently.
meanings.sent3: The town's autonomy in setting its own rules led to some interesting local laws.
meanings.sent4: The autonomy of the student council was evident in their ability to organize events.
meanings.sent5: The autonomy of the bees in the hive is crucial for their survival.

meanings.definition: The power or right of self-government.
meanings.sent1: Autonomies give communities the power to make their own choices.
meanings.sent2: The autonomies of the tribal leaders were respected by all members.
meanings.sent3: The autonomy of the children in deciding their game rules was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The autonomy of the artist in creating her work was truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The autonomy of the robot to navigate obstacles amazed the engineers.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being self-governing.
meanings.sent1: The autonomy of the organization allowed for efficient decision-making.
meanings.sent2: Countries strive for autonomies to manage their internal affairs.
meanings.sent3: The autonomy of the plants to grow in different conditions was amusing to observe.
meanings.sent4: The autonomy of the river to carve its path through the mountains was striking.
meanings.sent5: The autonomy of the ant colony in finding food sources was impressive.
